main event: A sighting report from Project Blue Book dated April 6, 1958, contains a summary indicating that the object observed was believed to be a part of a meteor, specifically articles of basaltic material.
interesting points: The report documents the submission of rock specimens thought to be meteorites., The specimen was confirmed to be typical basalt material by analysis., There is a handwritten correspondence regarding a supposed 'pot of gold' related to meteor finds., Oldtimers in the area claim there is gold in the hills based on anecdotal stories., The absence of any photographs in the report suggests it relies solely on documentation.
sighted object: basaltic material believed to be part of a meteor
witness description: The correspondence and report mention the perspectives of individuals who submitted specimens for examination.
